metadata.title: Beijing Trip Preparation
metadata.description: Learning Mandarin for an amazing trip to Beijing!

curriculum.lesson_topic: Beijing Trip Preparation: Learning Mandarin for an amazing trip to Beijing!

sub_topics.description: Learn how to greet people, introduce yourself, and use basic polite phrases to start your trip on a positive note.

sub_topics.sub_topic: Asking for Directions and Getting Around
sub_topics.description: Master asking for directions, understanding maps, and using public transportation so you can confidently navigate Beijing.

sub_topics.sub_topic: Ordering Food and Drinks in Restaurants
sub_topics.description: Learn essential phrases for ordering food and drinks in restaurants, understanding menus, and expressing dietary needs.
Practice essential vocabulary and phrases for shopping in markets, asking about prices, and bargaining respectfully.

sub_topics.sub_topic: Emergency Situations and Asking for Help
sub_topics.description: Learn crucial phrases for handling emergency situations, asking for help, and understanding basic medical terms.

flashcards.example: 你好！欢迎来到北京! (Nǐ hǎo! Huānyíng lái dào Běijīng!) - Hello! Welcome to Beijing!
谢谢你的帮助! (Xièxiè nǐ de bāngzhù!) - Thank you for your help!
不用谢，不客气。(Búyòng xiè, bú kèqì.) - No need to thank, you're welcome.
再见！祝你旅途愉快! (Zàijiàn! Zhù nǐ lǚtú yúkuài!) - Goodbye! Have a pleasant trip!
请问，洗手间在哪里？(Qǐngwèn, xǐshǒujiān zài nǎlǐ?) - Excuse me, where is the restroom?
这个多少钱？(Zhège duōshao qián?) - How much is this?
请问，厕所在哪里？(Qǐngwèn, cèsuǒ zài nǎlǐ?) - Excuse me, where is the toilet?
我要去长城。(Wǒ yào qù Chángchéng.) - I want to go to the Great Wall.
这是天安门广场。(Zhè shì Tiān'ānmén guǎngchǎng.) - This is Tiananmen Square.
我会说一点中文。(Wǒ huì shuō yīdiǎn Zhōngwén.) - I can speak a little Chinese.

exercises.explanation: The sentence translates to 'I will ___ the airplane to Beijing tomorrow.' '坐' (zuò) means 'to take' (a vehicle) and correctly fills the blank. '有' (yǒu) means 'to have', '在' (zài) means 'at', and '是' (shì) means 'is', none of which make sense in this context.

exercises.sentence: 北京的烤鸭___好吃，我每天都想吃。
exercises.explanation: The sentence translates to 'Beijing's roast duck is ___ delicious; I want to eat it every day.' '真' (zhēn) means 'really' or 'truly', emphasizing the deliciousness. '不' (bù) means 'not', '很' (hěn) means 'very', and '大' (dà) means 'big', none of which fit semantically to express the strong desire to eat it every day.

exercises.sentence: 在长城上，我___了很多照片。
exercises.explanation: The sentence translates to 'On the Great Wall, I ___ many photos.' '拍' (pāi) means 'to take' (a photo), which is the correct action. '玩' (wán) means 'to play', '看' (kàn) means 'to see', and '吃' (chī) means 'to eat', none of which fit the action of taking photos.

The sentence translates to 'Excuse me, ___ to go to Tiananmen Square?' '怎么' (zěnme) means 'how', asking for directions. '什么' (shénme) means 'what', '谁' (shuí) means 'who', and '哪儿' (nǎr) means 'where', none of which are appropriate for asking for directions.

exercises.sentence: 我喜欢住在北京，因为那里的人很___。
exercises.explanation: The sentence translates to 'I like living in Beijing because the people there are very ___.' '友好' (yǒuhǎo) means 'friendly', describing people's characteristics. '漂亮' (piàoliang) means 'beautiful', '大' (dà) means 'big', and '忙' (máng) means 'busy', none of which logically describe people in a positive way.

simulation.title: Planning Our Beijing Adventure
simulation.setting: Two friends, Alex and Meiling, are preparing for their first trip to Beijing. Alex is excited but knows very little Mandarin. Meiling, who is of Chinese heritage, is helping Alex learn some basic phrases for their journey. This dialogue focuses on practical phrases for navigating the city and enjoying the local culture.

content.speaker: Meiling
content.target_language_text: 你好，Alex! 准备好去北京了吗？(Nǐ hǎo, Alex! Zhǔnbèi hǎo qù Běijīng le ma?)
content.phonetics: Nǐ hǎo, Alex! Zhǔn bèi hǎo qù Běi jīng le ma?
content.base_language_translation: Hello, Alex! Are you ready to go to Beijing?

content.speaker: Alex
content.target_language_text: 你好，Meiling! 我很兴奋，但是我的中文不太好。(Nǐ hǎo, Meiling! Wǒ hěn xīngfèn, dànshì wǒ de Zhōngwén bù tài hǎo.)
content.phonetics: Nǐ hǎo, Meiling! Wǒ hěn xīng fèn, dàn shì wǒ de Zhōng wén bù tài hǎo.
content.base_language_translation: Hello, Meiling! I'm very excited, but my Chinese isn't very good.

content.speaker: Meiling
content.target_language_text: 没关系! 我会帮助你。 你可以说“谢谢” (xièxiè).
content.phonetics: Méi guānxi! Wǒ huì bāngzhù nǐ. Nǐ kěyǐ shuō “xièxiè”.
content.base_language_translation: It's okay! I will help you. You can say 'thank you' (xièxiè).

content.speaker: Meiling
content.target_language_text: 很好！ 还有，你可以问“请问，洗手间在哪里？”(Qǐngwèn, xǐshǒujiān zài nǎlǐ?)
content.phonetics: Qǐng wèn, xǐ shǒu jiān zài nǎ lǐ?
content.base_language_translation: Very good! Also, you can ask 'Excuse me, where is the restroom?'

content.speaker: Alex
content.target_language_text: 请问，洗手间在哪里？(Qǐngwèn, xǐshǒujiān zài nǎlǐ?)
content.phonetics: Qǐng wèn, xǐ shǒu jiān zài nǎ lǐ?
content.base_language_translation: Excuse me, where is the restroom?

content.speaker: Meiling
content.target_language_text: 对！如果你想买东西，可以说“这个多少钱？”(Zhège duōshao qián?)
content.base_language_translation: Correct! If you want to buy something, you can say 'How much is this?'

content.speaker: Meiling
content.target_language_text: 太棒了！ 最后，记住说 “再见” (Zàijiàn)!
content.phonetics: Tài bàng le! Zuì hòu, jì zhù shuō “Zài jiàn”!

content.speaker: Alex
content.target_language_text: 再见！ 我现在更自信了。(Zàijiàn! Wǒ xiànzài gèng zìxìn le.)
content.phonetics: Zài jiàn! Wǒ xiàn zài gèng zì xìn le.
content.base_language_translation: Goodbye! I feel more confident now.
